metadata.title: CVE-2021-47605 linux
metadata.description: In the Linux kernel, the following vulnerability has been resolved:  vduse: fix memory corruption in vduse_dev_ioctl()  The "config.offset" comes from the user.  There needs to a check to prevent it being out of bounds.  The "config.offset" and "dev->config_size" variables are both type u32.  So if the offset if out of bounds then the "dev->config_size - config.offset" subtraction results in a very high u32 value.  The out of bounds offset can result in memory corruption.
